# AI Vendor Agreement Addendum

**This AI Addendum** ("Addendum") supplements and is incorporated into the [Master Services Agreement / SaaS Agreement / Vendor Agreement] dated [Date] (the "Agreement") between:

**Customer:** [Name] ("Customer")
**Vendor:** [Name] ("Vendor")

## 1. DEFINITIONS

**"AI System"** means any artificial intelligence, machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision, or similar system provided by Vendor as part of the Services.

**"AI Output"** means any content, data, predictions, recommendations, decisions, or other results generated by the AI System.

**"Training Data"** means data used to train, fine-tune, validate, or test the AI System.

**"Customer Data"** has the meaning set forth in the Agreement and includes all data submitted by or on behalf of Customer to the AI System ("Inputs") and all AI Outputs generated for Customer.

## 2. DATA USAGE AND TRAINING

2.1 **No Training on Customer Data.** Vendor shall not use Customer Data (including Inputs and AI Outputs) to train, retrain, fine-tune, or otherwise improve any AI System, whether for Customer or any third party, except as expressly authorized in writing by Customer.

2.2 **No Third-Party Sharing.** Vendor shall not share, disclose, or make available Customer Data to any third party for AI training purposes.

2.3 **Sub-processor AI Training.** Vendor shall ensure that no sub-processor uses Customer Data for AI training purposes without Customer's prior written consent.

2.4 **Aggregated/De-identified Data.** [Optional: Vendor may use de-identified and aggregated data derived from Customer Data solely to improve the AI System, provided such data cannot reasonably be used to identify Customer, its employees, or any individual.]

## 3. AI SYSTEM TRANSPARENCY

3.1 **Documentation.** Vendor shall provide documentation describing:
- (a) The general capabilities and limitations of the AI System;
- (b) The types of data used to train the AI System;
- (c) Known biases, failure modes, and risk factors;
- (d) Performance metrics and evaluation results;
- (e) The involvement of any third-party AI providers or models.

3.2 **Changes.** Vendor shall notify Customer at least [30] days before making material changes to the AI System that could affect its outputs, accuracy, or behavior.

3.3 **Third-Party Models.** Vendor shall disclose all third-party AI models, APIs, or services used in providing the AI System, including [OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Meta, etc.].

## 4. ACCURACY AND RELIABILITY

4.1 **No Guarantee of Accuracy.** Customer acknowledges that AI Outputs may contain errors, inaccuracies, or biases. AI Outputs are not a substitute for professional judgment.

4.2 **Performance Standards.** Vendor shall maintain the AI System performance standards specified in Exhibit A [accuracy rates, response times, availability, etc.].

4.3 **Monitoring.** Vendor shall implement reasonable monitoring to detect degradation in AI System performance, bias drift, or anomalous outputs.

4.4 **Human Review.** Where AI Outputs are used for decisions with legal or significant effects on individuals, Customer shall implement appropriate human review processes.

## 5. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

5.1 **Inputs.** Customer retains all intellectual property rights in Inputs.

5.2 **Outputs.** [Select one:]
- [ ] AI Outputs are deemed Customer Data, and Customer retains all rights therein.
- [ ] Vendor grants Customer a perpetual, non-exclusive, worldwide license to use AI Outputs.
- [ ] IP rights in AI Outputs shall be allocated as follows: [specify].

5.3 **Similar Outputs.** Customer acknowledges that the AI System may generate similar or identical Outputs for other customers.

5.4 **Model IP.** Nothing in this Addendum transfers ownership of the underlying AI System, models, algorithms, or training data to Customer.

## 6. COMPLIANCE AND ETHICS

6.1 **Applicable Laws.** Vendor shall comply with all applicable laws relating to AI, including:
- [EU AI Act / state AI laws / sector-specific requirements]
- Anti-discrimination and civil rights laws
- Consumer protection laws
- Data protection laws (GDPR, CCPA, etc.)

6.2 **Prohibited Uses.** The AI System shall not be used for:
- (a) Decisions that discriminate on the basis of protected characteristics;
- (b) Mass surveillance or individual profiling without legal basis;
- (c) Generating deceptive content (deepfakes) intended to mislead;
- (d) Autonomous weapons or systems designed to cause harm;
- (e) Social scoring or manipulation of vulnerable populations.

6.3 **Bias Testing.** Vendor shall conduct regular bias and fairness testing of the AI System and make results available to Customer upon request.

6.4 **Impact Assessment.** Upon Customer's request, Vendor shall cooperate in conducting an AI impact assessment for Customer's intended use of the AI System.

## 7. SECURITY

7.1 **AI-Specific Security.** In addition to the security obligations in the Agreement, Vendor shall:
- (a) Implement measures to prevent adversarial attacks, prompt injection, and data poisoning;
- (b) Maintain access controls for the AI System and Training Data;
- (c) Log and audit AI System access and usage;
- (d) Implement measures to prevent unintended data leakage through AI Outputs.

7.2 **Incident Response.** Vendor shall notify Customer within [24/48/72] hours of discovering any AI-specific security incident, including model compromise, training data breach, or adversarial exploitation.

## 8. INDEMNIFICATION

8.1 **IP Indemnity.** Vendor shall indemnify Customer against claims that the AI System or AI Outputs infringe third-party intellectual property rights, [subject to / excluding the limitations in the Agreement].

8.2 **Compliance Indemnity.** Vendor shall indemnify Customer against claims arising from Vendor's failure to comply with applicable AI laws.

8.3 **Exclusions.** Vendor shall not be liable for claims arising from: (a) Customer's modification of AI Outputs; (b) Customer's use of AI Outputs contrary to Vendor's documentation or this Addendum; (c) Customer's failure to implement human review where required.

## 9. AUDIT RIGHTS

9.1 Customer shall have the right, upon reasonable notice, to audit Vendor's compliance with this Addendum, including review of AI System documentation, bias testing results, and security measures.

## 10. TERMINATION EFFECTS

10.1 Upon termination of the Agreement, Vendor shall: (a) cease processing Customer Data through the AI System; (b) return or delete Customer Data per the Agreement; (c) confirm in writing that no Customer Data remains in Training Data.

---

| Item | Specification |
